data.title: Binance Wallet’s Momentum Pre-TGE Prime Sale Edition Details
data.description: Binance announced the details of the upcoming Binance Wallet Pre-TGE Prime Sale Edition featuring Momentum (MMT). The subscription cap per Binance Wallet user will be 7 BNB, not reaching the cap is allowed. Users can claim their MMT Key (BSC) after the Pre-TGE phase and actual MMT on Sui will be airdropped to users' Binance Alpha accounts on TGE date.Momentum Subscription Details:Token Name: MMTChain: SuiSubscription Period: 2025-10-31 09:00 to 2025-10-31 11:00 (UTC)Total Raise Amount: $1,500,000 in BNBTotal Token Amount: 15,000,000 MMT tokens (1.5% of total supply)Accepted Token: BNBPrice per Token: $0.1 USD equivalent in BNBSubscription Cap per Binance Wallet User: 7 BNBParticipant Eligibility: To qualify, participants must have required Binance Alpha Points during the subscription period. Participation in this Prime Sale event will deduct 15 points.Alpha and DEX Trading Time: 2025-11-4 10:00 (UTC)

data.title: NovaRWA and Mapleblock Capital Form Strategic Partnership
data.description: According to Odaily, NovaRWA, a project focused on RWA infrastructure, has announced a strategic partnership with Web3 investment firm Mapleblock Capital. The collaboration aims to enhance the on-chain integration of RWA assets, expand the ecosystem, and drive market growth, thereby accelerating the application of real-world assets in the blockchain sector. Additionally, NovaRWA plans to initiate trading and circulation by mid-next month, with further details to be released soon.

data.title: Mixed Performance for Cryptocurrency Stocks in Pre-Market Trading
data.description: According to BlockBeats, cryptocurrency-related stocks showed varied performance in pre-market trading on October 30. MSTR experienced a decline of 0.20%, while COIN saw an increase of 0.27%. HOOD fell by 0.37%, and SBET rose by 0.81%. Meanwhile, BMNR decreased by 0.42%, and CRCL dropped by 0.08%.

data.title: Bitcoin Holders Maintain Steady Selling Pressure, Analysis Reveals
data.description:
According to Foresight News, analysis by Glassnode indicates that Bitcoin long-term holders have maintained a consistent selling pressure since mid-July, keeping the market below $126,000. Data shows that the daily average selling by long-term holders increased from approximately $1 billion in mid-July to $2-3 billion by early October. Unlike previous high-selling phases in this bull market, the current distribution pattern is gradual and sustained rather than characterized by sharp, short-term sell-offs.

Further analysis by holding period reveals that investors holding Bitcoin for 6-12 months have contributed to over 50% of the recent selling pressure, particularly noticeable during the later stages of price peaks. Near Bitcoin's all-time high of $126,000, this group’s daily average selling reached $648 million, a more than fivefold increase from early 2025 baseline levels. The data also shows that these investors accumulated significant amounts of Bitcoin between October 2024 (during the U.S. election period) and April 2025, with a cost basis ranging from $70,000 to $96,000, averaging around $93,000. Analysts note that if Bitcoin's price falls below the $93,000-$96,000 range, this group would face the greatest loss pressure.

data.description:
Eli Lilly’s Q3 2025 revenue jumped 54% to $17. 6 billion with adjusted EPS of $7. 02, prompting the company to lift its full-year guidance.

data.title: NovaRWA Announces Strategic Partnership with Mapleblock Capital
data.description: Recently, NovaRWA, the RWA infrastructure project, announced a strategic partnership with Web3 investment firm Mapleblock Capital. The two parties will collaborate deeply on RWA asset on-chaining, ecosystem expansion, and market growth, accelerating the application of real-world assets in the blockchain field. Furthermore, the project team revealed that NovaRWA will begin trading and circulation in mid-next month, with more details to be announced soon.

data.title: Bitcoin mining company TeraWulf expands its private placement to $900 million.
data.description: Bitcoin mining company TeraWulf announced it is expanding its private placement to $900 million and finalizing the terms. The offering consists of 0% convertible senior notes due in 2032, with an over-allotment option of $125 million. This offering is an extension of the company's previously disclosed $500 million funding plan, with initial purchasers having a 13-day option to subscribe for additional notes. The company stated that the zero-coupon notes have a conversion premium of 37.5%, which translates to an initial conversion price of approximately $19.94 per share based on Wednesday's closing price of $14.50. If the over-allotment option is fully exercised, the total funding will reach approximately $999.7 million, which will be used for the construction of a data center campus in Abernathy, Texas, and other corporate purposes. (THE BLOCK)

data.title: Australian Police Uncover $6 Million in Cryptocurrency from Criminal Wallet
data.description: According to BlockBeats, Australian Federal Police Commissioner Krissy Barrett announced on Wednesday that a data scientist from the Criminal Asset Confiscation Taskforce successfully unlocked a cryptocurrency wallet containing over $6 million, believed to be held by a suspect. The breakthrough was achieved by identifying falsified numbers within the seed phrase sequence used to secure the wallet. The suspect had attempted to create a 'crypto trap' by adding numbers to the sequence, but the manual alterations were ultimately detected.

data.title: Mastercard In 'Late-Stage Talks' To Acquire Crypto Startup Zerohash: Report
data.description:
